meanings.definition: The quality of being deserving of praise or commendation.
meanings.sent1: Her laudableness was evident in the way she always helped others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent2: The laudableness of his actions earned him the admiration of his peers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mischievous nature, his laudableness shone through when he rescued the kitten stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The laudableness of her character was like a beacon of light in a world filled with darkness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's laudableness inspired her students to strive for excellence in all they did.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being praiseworthy.
meanings.sent1: The laudableness of the team's victory brought joy to the entire town.
meanings.sent2: His laudableness as a leader was recognized by all who worked with him.
meanings.sent3: The laudableness of the cake she baked was so great that it disappeared within minutes at the party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, her laudableness as a singer was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The laudableness of his artwork left spectators in awe of his talent.
